cosmos.anomaly: attach(arm connector → boom) violates correct physical hierarchy and spatial relationships, disrupting mechanical compatibility and assembly logic
cosmos.physical_analysis: Attaching the arm connector to the boom instead of the chassis invalidates the intended assembly hierarchy, causing misalignment and preventing proper function. The chassis must serve as the foundational structure for all components, and incorrect placements invalidate downstream connections like the arm and boom. Cascade failures occur due to disrupted assembly logic.
cosmos.root_cause: Operator mistakenly assigned the arm connector to the boom rather than the chassis, violating the established hierarchy and physical constraints.
cosmos.corrective_action: 1. Detach arm connector from boom and reconnect to chassis. 2. Verify all components are correctly ordered and aligned. 3. Test the assembled structure for functionality.
cosmos.full_response:
<answer>
ANOMALY CONFIRMED: attach(arm connector → boom) violates correct physical hierarchy and spatial relationships, disrupting mechanical compatibility and assembly logic
PHYSICAL ANALYSIS: Attaching the arm connector to the boom instead of the chassis invalidates the intended assembly hierarchy, causing misalignment and preventing proper function. The chassis must serve as the foundational structure for all components, and incorrect placements invalidate downstream connections like the arm and boom. Cascade failures occur due to disrupted assembly logic.
ROOT CAUSE: Operator mistakenly assigned the arm connector to the boom rather than the chassis, violating the established hierarchy and physical constraints.
SEVERITY: CRITICAL
CORRECTIVE ACTION: 1. Detach arm connector from boom and reconnect to chassis. 2. Verify all components are correctly ordered and aligned. 3. Test the assembled structure for functionality.
CONFIDENCE: 95%
